page.title: 03Cote Farm, Aust
page.content: Cote Farm is three hundred and eighty-eight years old. The present owner has lived on the farm since 1940 and inherited it from his father. The farm covers three hundred and eighty acres and ninety eight acres are used for growing wheat. There are a number of animals: 110 dairy cows; 15 calfs; 35 beef cows; 220 lambs and 200 hens. The cows are fed at 6 a.m. each morning and then milked; the other animals are fed a little later. Four people work on the farm and they have: 4 tractors; 3 cars; 1 combine-harvester and 1 land-rover. The farm has its own water supply _ although today the waterpump is powered by electricity, not wind. Work begins at 6 a.m. and finishes at 6 p.m.
